item.description: Honestly, it’s probably the phones The most plausible explanation for teenage unhappiness. As a proud owner of a teenager, I 100% agree. Teaching them to self regulate is important!

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: Today was incredibly special. I got to spend the it with my three children snowboarding on the mountain. I‚Äôve had the privilege of teaching each one of them how to snowboard and we are now at this point where we can all just ride together and have fun. Feeling very grateful.

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: I‚Äôm taking all 3 of my kids snowboarding today by myself. Wish me luck (and patience) üèÇ

item.title: Idea: Micropub Browser Extension For Replies!!!!!!!
item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: I LOVE finding sites that support webmentions. For me, it’s an instant subscribe. These are people who are looking to build community on the web in a new way. The process of “replying” and sending a webmention to a post is still a bit cumbersome. Here are the current steps: Read an article that I want to respond to Determine if the article supports webmentions (either they offer a URL box OR you have to view the source to see if they have a webmention endpoint).

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: You just blew my mind. So that basically defeats PKCE?

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: True, but it would be tricky. Wouldn‚Äôt the attacker have find a way to extract the code_verifier from local storage and pass it along with the hijacked redirect? They would have to somehow have the ability to write custom js code on the path they are redirecting to. I guess this is possible on sites that don‚Äôt sanitize user inputs.

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: Could using PKCE fix this issue?

item.description: Mark the calendar. My oldest son finally beat me at chess tonight (ignore his disheveled hair). item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: 2D Liquid Simulator With Cellular Automaton One interesting way to represent liquids in a grid based world, is to use a form of cellular automaton. I love seeing when complex behavior emerges from simple rules. This is very cool.

item.author: brandontreb@gmail.com (|Zero Cool|)
item.description: Self hosting in 2023 The blog that you are currently reading has a perfect PageSpeed score 100 / 100 Pretty cool write up of how to achieve solid performance hosting a (static) site on a Raspberry Pi in your closet. Self-hosting fascinates me to no end.
